description: Consolidate 3 redundant documentation commands (/record-changes, /update-docs, /update-foundation-docs) into a single unified /update-docs command with scope flags (--changelog-only, --with-foundation) to eliminate confusion and reduce maintenance burden.
goal: Reduce 3 confusing documentation commands to 1 flexible command that handles all documentation update scenarios with clear flags, improving user experience and reducing decision fatigue.
requirements: Merge update_all_documentation and record_changes tools into unified tool with scope parameter
Add --changelog-only flag to /update-docs for quick CHANGELOG.json updates (replaces /record-changes)
Add --with-foundation flag to /update-docs for API.md/my-guide.md/user-guide.md updates (replaces /update-foundation-docs)
Default behavior updates README + CLAUDE.md + CHANGELOG.json (current /update-docs behavior)
Maintain backward compatibility with existing workflows
Update /complete-workorder to use new unified command
Add deprecation notices to old commands with migration guidance
Update all workflow documentation to reference unified command
out_of_scope: Modifying foundation doc templates (API.md, user-guide.md, etc.)
Adding new documentation types beyond current scope
constraints: Must preserve all current functionality (no feature loss)
Git-based auto-detection from record_changes must be retained
Agent-based context from update_all_documentation must be retained
Semantic versioning auto-increment must work correctly
CHANGELOG.json schema validation must be maintained

decisions.tool_consolidation: Merge update_all_documentation + record_changes into unified tool
decisions.migration_strategy: Deprecation notices with 1-2 version grace period

success_criteria.user_experience: Users only need to remember one documentation command
success_criteria.feature_parity: All functionality from 3 commands available in unified command
success_criteria.documentation_clarity: Workflow docs show single clear path for doc updates
